intro: Pachecoa, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, often pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to several feet. Its flowers are typically clustered in racemes and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pachecoa species are often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in some areas.
